hotspots.label: Terminal Block Connector
hotspots.fact: This green terminal block is where wires connect to safely deliver electricity to different parts of a building or device. Each numbered slot can hold one wire, and they're color-coded to help electricians know which wires go where!

hotspots.label: Capacitor Component
hotspots.fact: This yellow box is a capacitor that stores electrical energy, like a tiny battery. Capacitors help smooth out electrical power and protect equipment from sudden power surges that could damage it.

hotspots.label: Color-Coded Wires
hotspots.fact: These wires use different colors (red, black, green, yellow, blue) so electricians can tell them apart and connect them safely. Each color has a specific job, like red for power and black for ground.

hotspots.label: Wire Stripping Tool
hotspots.fact: This copper wire being exposed shows how electricians prepare wires for connections. Removing the colored plastic coating reveals the metal inside that actually carries the electrical current.
